title: The Prime Minister is approaching his moment of truth – and so is Jeremy Corbyn
text:
For the first time since the Falklands war 37 years ago, Parliament is to sit on a Saturday, as the Brexit drama approaches a climacteric. On October 19, MPs will gather at Westminster, either to endorse a deal with the EU secured by Boris Johnson at next week’s summit or to decide what happens next if he has failed.

On that April day in 1982, Labour was led by its most Left-wing leader until Jeremy Corbyn arrived in the post. Michael Foot delivered a patriotic speech that one leading Tory said “spoke for us all”. It is unlikely we will hear the same from Mr Corbyn next week. For him, the interests of the nation are of secondary importance to the opportunity to embarrass and wrong-foot Mr Johnson....
description: For the first time since the Falklands war 37 years ago, Parliament is to sit on a Saturday, as the Brexit drama approaches a climacteric.
